title: Pet subjects: Can I treat my pet for fleas and worms without using chemicals?
text:
Dear Pete

Last week you mentioned calls for compulsory microchipping of cats. My lilac point Siamese cat, Kobe, was chipped and he wore a GPS collar, but he was stolen nearly three months ago (see #FindKobe). Someone took his collar off and left it on the ground. Is there a tamper-proof way of tracking the location of cats?

DS, Sevenoaks

Dear DS

Technological advances have made GPS trackers smaller and smaller, but they are not yet tiny enough to be implantable. Tamper-proof GPS collars that can be locked on an animal are not sold for cats as there is a risk of a free-ranging cat choking, should the collar catch on something.
